mainText:
Welcome to Bank of Entitlement, where every customer is treated like royalty! Experience the luxury of never having to wait for your demands to be met.

Visit Bank of Entitlement dot com for more.

ENTITLEMENT STORY: So, get this-I was at a fancy rooftop party last night, right? The host ran out of champagne, so naturally, I stood up on a table and announced to everyone that I was leaving because it was unacceptable. As I dramatically made my way to the elevator, people tried to stop me, but I just waved them off.Once I got downstairs, I called my personal driver to pick me up immediately. I needed to go buy my own champagne since these peasants couldn't provide for me. The driver arrived in record time, and we sped off to a high-end liquor store.I stormed into the store, demanding the finest champagne they had. The staff scrambled to assist me, but I was already browsing the selection like I owned the place. Finally, I selected a rare vintage bottle that cost more than most people's monthly rent.At the counter, I whipped out my black card, making sure everyone saw it. As the cashier processed the transaction, I loudly complained about the inconvenience and how my night was ruined. But when that bottle was safely tucked under my arm, I felt a rush of empowerment. Who needs a party when you can have your own personal champagne adventure?And let me tell you, sipping that expensive champagne in the back of the car on the way home, I knew I had made the right choice. Because in the end, it's all about me, right? Cheers to being entitled!
